comment_data.body: Why doesn't this apply to `completionItemKind` below?

comment_regular_data.body: Do we really need the reverse lookup? I kinda think that (adding reverse keys _to the same table_) was an anti-pattern...
(Don't want to block a quick fix, but worth a brief look if avoiding adding these keys in the first place is similarly easy.)

> Do we really need the reverse lookup? I kinda think that (adding reverse keys _to the same table_) was an anti-pattern...

That's a good point. This was already done prior to #27526, and I kept the behavior. Seems like this has been the case since the initial design: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/11336

Oh, yes, this pattern was part of the Cambrian Explosion of Nvim 0.5 (back when men were _real_ men, and women were _real_ women, and Lua modules were _real_ Lua modules). We've revisited and rethought a few such patterns since then, and that's one I think we should reconsider as well. (Not necessarily now; it's probably a bigger refactor here.)
Okay I've changed this fix to instead remove the reverse lookup.
I think there are a couple places in the codebase that rely on the lookup that need fixing up. CI will tell all.

> I think there are a couple places in the codebase that rely on the lookup that need fixing up. CI will tell all.

I'm also checking this manually. Moving it to a draft in the meantime.
Okay try 3: I want to fix https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27526#issuecomment-1962940151 for now. Removing the usage of the reverse lookup should be part of a larger (future) refactor.
Makes sense, but maybe add a todo comment to the fix about replacing it with that refactor?

> Makes sense, but maybe add a todo comment to the fix about replacing it with that refactor?

Isn't [this comment](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/13aa962c2fcebc4bf800f626457ce6db7f74710b/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/protocol.lua#L304) enough?
Very much so. I apologize for commenting before reviewing the code.

> Very much so. I apologize for commenting before reviewing the code.

No need to apologize, as always, thank you for reviewing <3
ðŸ’¯ thanks for working on this, @MariaSolOs!
